word: Put an almond on top of each square filled with jam.
tran: 在每个装满果酱的方块上放一颗杏仁。
cn: 在每个装满果酱的方块上放一颗杏仁。
en: Put an almond on top of each square filled with jam.

word: Most everything on the menu is vegetarian-friendly, but carnivores can add a fried egg or slabs of bacon to any item for two bucks.
tran: 菜单上的大多数食物都是素食主义者，但肉食者可以花两美元在任何食物中添加煎鸡蛋或培根片。
cn: 菜单上的大多数食物都是素食主义者，但肉食者可以花两美元在任何食物中添加煎鸡蛋或培根片。
en: Most everything on the menu is vegetarian-friendly, but carnivores can add a fried egg or slabs of bacon to any item for two bucks.

word: She would often buy them peanut butter cookies in large quantities as treats.
tran: 她经常给他们买大量的花生酱饼干作为款待。
cn: 她经常给他们买大量的花生酱饼干作为款待。
en: She would often buy them peanut butter cookies in large quantities as treats.

word: At least have some toast or bacon.
tran: 至少吃一些吐司或培根。
cn: 至少吃一些吐司或培根。
en: At least have some toast or bacon.

word: Be sure to discard the first waffle batch, which can absorb some unpleasant oiliness.
tran: 一定要丢弃第一批华夫饼，它会吸收一些令人不愉快的油腻感。
cn: 一定要丢弃第一批华夫饼，它会吸收一些令人不愉快的油腻感。
en: Be sure to discard the first waffle batch, which can absorb some unpleasant oiliness.

word: My jam is too sweet.
tran: 我的果酱太甜了。
cn: 我的果酱太甜了。
en: My jam is too sweet.

word: Ladle the batter into each well of the waffle maker and close the lid.
tran: 将面糊舀入华夫饼机的每个孔中，然后盖上盖子。
cn: 将面糊舀入华夫饼机的每个孔中，然后盖上盖子。
en: Ladle the batter into each well of the waffle maker and close the lid.

word: Or cut up plastic yoghurt tubs and write on these to use as labels instead.
tran: 或者切开塑料酸奶桶并在上面写字以用作标签。
cn: 或者切开塑料酸奶桶并在上面写字以用作标签。
en: Or cut up plastic yoghurt tubs and write on these to use as labels instead.

word: The subject of equality has an expiration date, like peanut butter.
tran: 平等这个话题就像花生酱一样，是有有效期的。
cn: 平等这个话题就像花生酱一样，是有有效期的。
en: The subject of equality has an expiration date, like peanut butter.

word: It seemed like a good idea to cut out peanut butter, then bread.
tran: 戒掉花生酱，然后戒掉面包似乎是个好主意。
cn: 戒掉花生酱，然后戒掉面包似乎是个好主意。
en: It seemed like a good idea to cut out peanut butter, then bread.

word: Waffle House is expecting a slow recovery.
tran: 华夫饼屋预计会缓慢复苏。
cn: 华夫饼屋预计会缓慢复苏。
en: Waffle House is expecting a slow recovery.

word: They had 348 different kinds of jam.
tran: 他们有348种不同的果酱。
cn: 他们有348种不同的果酱。
en: They had 348 different kinds of jam.

word: You can swap other nut or seed butters for the peanut butter.
tran: 您可以用其他坚果或种子酱代替花生酱。
cn: 您可以用其他坚果或种子酱代替花生酱。
en: You can swap other nut or seed butters for the peanut butter.

word: Roasted and rolled oatmeal, eaten as porridge, requires brief boiling.
tran: 烤燕麦片和燕麦片作为粥食用，需要短暂煮沸。
cn: 烤燕麦片和燕麦片作为粥食用，需要短暂煮沸。
en: Roasted and rolled oatmeal, eaten as porridge, requires brief boiling.

word: He had never cooked anything more elaborate than a fried egg.
tran: 他从来没有煮过比煎鸡蛋更精致的东西。
cn: 他从来没有煮过比煎鸡蛋更精致的东西。
en: He had never cooked anything more elaborate than a fried egg.

word: If you are someone who has dry skin then opt for yoghurt or milk.
tran: 如果您是干性皮肤，请选择酸奶或牛奶。
cn: 如果您是干性皮肤，请选择酸奶或牛奶。
en: If you are someone who has dry skin then opt for yoghurt or milk.

word: Here, we invite you to pop a fried egg on top.
tran: 在这里，我们邀请您在上面放一个煎鸡蛋。
cn: 在这里，我们邀请您在上面放一个煎鸡蛋。
en: Here, we invite you to pop a fried egg on top.

word: Divide the mixture between four warm shallow bowls and top each one with a fried egg.
tran: 将混合物分装在四个温暖的浅碗中，并在每个碗上放一个煎鸡蛋。
cn: 将混合物分装在四个温暖的浅碗中，并在每个碗上放一个煎鸡蛋。
en: Divide the mixture between four warm shallow bowls and top each one with a fried egg.

word: “I love oatmeal, Mama.”
tran: “妈妈，我喜欢吃燕麦片。”
cn: “妈妈，我喜欢吃燕麦片。”
en: “I love oatmeal, Mama.”

word: Working as fast as she could, she started a pot of coffee and sliced some ham.
tran: 她以最快的速度煮了一壶咖啡，切了一些火腿。
cn: 她以最快的速度煮了一壶咖啡，切了一些火腿。
en: Working as fast as she could, she started a pot of coffee and sliced some ham.

word: Her stomach grumbled but the thought of a ham sandwich disgusted her.
tran: 她的肚子咕咕叫，但一想到火腿三明治就感到恶心。
cn: 她的肚子咕咕叫，但一想到火腿三明治就感到恶心。
en: Her stomach grumbled but the thought of a ham sandwich disgusted her.

word: The scent of bacon reached her from the kitchen.
tran: 熏肉的香味从厨房里传到她身上。
cn: 熏肉的香味从厨房里传到她身上。
en: The scent of bacon reached her from the kitchen.

word: Ease the cooked waffle out of the waffle iron.
tran: 将煮熟的华夫饼从华夫饼熨斗中取出。
cn: 将煮熟的华夫饼从华夫饼熨斗中取出。
en: Ease the cooked waffle out of the waffle iron.

word: She opened the refrigerator - milk, eggs, and bacon - the usual supplies.
tran: 她打开冰箱——牛奶、鸡蛋和培根——平常的用品。
cn: 她打开冰箱——牛奶、鸡蛋和培根——平常的用品。
en: She opened the refrigerator - milk, eggs, and bacon - the usual supplies.

word: Once cooked, slice and serve on its own or with additional fruit and yoghurt.
tran: 煮熟后，切片并单独食用或与其他水果和酸奶一起食用。
cn: 煮熟后，切片并单独食用或与其他水果和酸奶一起食用。
en: Once cooked, slice and serve on its own or with additional fruit and yoghurt.

word: Buy according to what you plan to use oatmeal for.
tran: 根据您计划使用燕麦片的目的购买。
cn: 根据您计划使用燕麦片的目的购买。
en: Buy according to what you plan to use oatmeal for.

word: Put the jam in a bowl, add the nutmeg and mix.
tran: 将果酱放入碗中，加入肉豆蔻并混合。
cn: 将果酱放入碗中，加入肉豆蔻并混合。
en: Put the jam in a bowl, add the nutmeg and mix.

word: That's all thanks to the oatmeal extract.
tran: 这都要归功于燕麦提取物。
cn: 这都要归功于燕麦提取物。
en: That's all thanks to the oatmeal extract.

word: We walked into the kitchen where Mrs. Thompson was pulling out a ham.
tran: 我们走进厨房，汤普森太太正在拿出火腿。
cn: 我们走进厨房，汤普森太太正在拿出火腿。
en: We walked into the kitchen where Mrs. Thompson was pulling out a ham.

word: Let's create an observation dataset based on the first keyword yoghurt.
tran: 让我们根据第一个关键字酸奶创建一个观察数据集。
cn: 让我们根据第一个关键字酸奶创建一个观察数据集。
en: Let's create an observation dataset based on the first keyword yoghurt.

word: They stop at floors unnecessarily, overload and jam.
tran: 他们不必要地停在楼层、超载和堵塞。
cn: 他们不必要地停在楼层、超载和堵塞。
en: They stop at floors unnecessarily, overload and jam.
